Intercepted: Alice encrypted the flag with RSA using a modulus equal to a product of two Blum primes. Break it: 888522904050730265135970068172977655507035344084514096197282589507090753987629034035298121590903737191371255731513709791749069808408512385817825295215928

n=9883806728695143649305977091427074136108787148752210973235524254177803540367079778737038465921105803614407762773067476774261654413118924398366561787290169, e=875693986899953342968365477252830653041859357204592465747919936216860443724333076429364920766713050844353524947703191069527650300335448760851413611797819
The lower 104 bits of p are: 18444711226538309323813000690033677931


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{s2uo0wkh}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 888522904050730265135970068172977655507035344084514096197282589507090753987629034035298121590903737191371255731513709791749069808408512385817825295215928
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=9883806728695143649305977091427074136108787148752210973235524254177803540367079778737038465921105803614407762773067476774261654413118924398366561787290169, e=875693986899953342968365477252830653041859357204592465747919936216860443724333076429364920766713050844353524947703191069527650300335448760851413611797819
The lower 104 bits of p are: 18444711226538309323813000690033677931
